info.michaelkohler.helpertools.collections

Class CollectionHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.michaelkohler.helpertools.collections.CollectionHelper

  • public final class CollectionHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    The |CollectionHelper| is a static class which helps performing batch operations on collections.
    Version:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Lukas Diener

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> all(java.util.Collection<T> collection, java.lang.String property)
      Collects a specific property of elements in a collection and returns them as a Collection.
      static <T> void each(java.util.Collection<T> collection, IFunction function)
      Calls a function for every element in a collection with the element as first parameter and the index as the second.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • all

        public static <T> java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> all(java.util.Collection<T> collection,
                                             java.lang.String property)
                                                  throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Collects a specific property of elements in a collection and returns them as a Collection. It's possible to access private properties.
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection to be traversed
        property - the name of the property to be extracted
        Returns:
        a Collection of the selected properties
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - Signals that the class doesn't have a field of a specified name.

      • each

        public static <T> void each(java.util.Collection<T> collection,
            IFunction function)
        Calls a function for every element in a collection with the element as first parameter and the index as the second. 
         // be myCollection a |Collection| of class myClass, which
 // contains a property named myProperty of type |String|.
 CollectionHelper.each(stringCollection, new IFunction() {
   public void execute(Object o, int index ) {
     String s = (String) o;
     System.out.println("myProperty of element at index "+index+
                               " has value "+s.myProperty);
   }
 });
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection to be traversed
        function - the method to be executed
